dataclasses/predicates.js

  1. const { merge } = require('ramda');
  2. const $_type = require('./$_type');
  4. module.exports = ({ invariants }) => {
  5.   /**
  6.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  7.    * @typedef {object} Predicate
  8.    * @memberof dataclasses
  9.    */
  11.   /**
  12.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  13.    * @param {Function} type - Predicate subtype function constructor
  14.    * @return {dataclasses.Predicate}
  15.    * @memberof dataclasses
  16.    */
  17.   function Predicate(type) {
  18.     return invariants
  19.       .PredicateTypeMustBeValid(type.name, Predicate.Types)
  20.       .then(() =>
  21.         merge($_type(type.name), {
  22.           /**
  23.            * $canBeRemoved specify if the predicate can be removed or not from the Predicates tree
  24.            * @type {Boolean}
  25.            *  @memberof Predicate
  26.            */
  27.           $canBeRemoved: true,
  28.         })
  29.       );
  30.   }
  32.   Predicate.Types = {
  33.     ComparisonPredicate: 'ComparisonPredicate',
  34.     CompoundPredicate: 'CompoundPredicate',
  35.   };
  37.   /**
  38.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  39.    * @typedef {object} ComparisonPredicate
  40.    * @param {string} target - unique id for this target
  41.    * @param {string} operator - label that will be displayed for this target
  42.    * @param {string} arguments - the type_id name this target has
  43.    * @memberof dataclasses
  44.    */
  46.   /**
  47.    * A specialized predicate that you use to compare expressions.
  48.    * @param  {dataclasses.Target} target
  49.    * @param  {dataclasses.Operator} operator
  50.    * @param  {Array<*>} args
  51.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate>} yield a ComparisonPredicate or a rejected promise
  52.    * @memberof dataclasses
  53.    */
  54.   function ComparisonPredicate(target, operator, args) {
  55.     return Predicate(ComparisonPredicate).then(predicate =>
  56.       merge(predicate, {
  57.         target: target,
  58.         operator: operator,
  59.         arguments: args,
  60.       })
  61.     );
  62.   }
  64.   /**
  65.    * Yield true if `predicate` is a ComparisonPredicate
  66.    * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate}  predicate {@link dataclasses.Predicate}
  67.    * @return {Boolean}
  68.    * @memberof dataclasses
  69.    */
  70.   ComparisonPredicate.is = predicate => {
  71.     return (
  72.       predicate && predicate.$_type === Predicate.Types.ComparisonPredicate
  73.     );
  74.   };
  76.   /**
  77.    * A specialized predicate that evaluates logical combinations of other predicates.
  78.    * @param {dataclasses.LogicalType} logic The predicate logic
  79.    * @param {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates predicates
  80.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>} yield a {@link dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} or a {@link errors.CompoundPredicateMustHaveAtLeastOneSubPredicate} rejected promise
  81.    * @memberof dataclasses
  82.    */
  83.   function CompoundPredicate(logic, predicates) {
  84.     return invariants
  85.       .CompoundPredicateMustHaveAtLeastOneSubPredicate(
  86.         predicates,
  87.         CompoundPredicate
  88.       )
  89.       .then(() => Predicate(CompoundPredicate))
  90.       .then(predicate =>
  91.         merge(predicate, {
  92.           logic: logic,
  93.           predicates: predicates,
  94.         })
  95.       );
  96.   }
  98.   /**
  99.    * Reduce through the predicates tree
  100.    * @param       {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} compoundPredicate starter node
  101.    * @param       {function} f accumulation function, f(acc, predicate, parents)
  102.    * @param       {T} acc               accumulator
  103.    * @param       {Array}  [parents=[]]      path to the node, array of parents
  104.    * @return      {T} yield the accumulator
  105.    * @memberof dataclasses
  106.    */
  107.   CompoundPredicate.reduce = function(compoundPredicate, f, acc, parents = []) {
  108.     acc = f(acc, compoundPredicate, parents);
  109.     return compoundPredicate.predicates.reduce((_acc, predicate, i) => {
  110.       const _parents = parents.concat([compoundPredicate, [predicate, i]]);
  111.       return CompoundPredicate.is(predicate)
  112.         ? CompoundPredicate.reduce(predicate, f, _acc, _parents)
  113.         : f(_acc, predicate, _parents);
  114.     }, acc);
  115.   };
  117.   /**
  118.    * Walk through the predicates tree
  119.    * @param       {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} compoundPredicate starter node
  120.    * @param       {Function} f(predicate) iterator function
  121.    * @memberof dataclasses
  122.    */
  123.   CompoundPredicate.forEach = (compoundPredicate, f) => {
  124.     CompoundPredicate.reduce(
  125.       compoundPredicate,
  126.       (_, predicate, __) => {
  127.         f(predicate);
  128.       },
  129.       null
  130.     );
  131.   };
  133.   /**
  134.    * Yield true if `predicate` is a CompoundPredicate
  135.    * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate}  predicate
  136.    * @return {Boolean}
  137.    * @memberof dataclasses
  138.    */
  139.   CompoundPredicate.is = predicate =>
  140.     predicate && predicate.$_type === Predicate.Types.CompoundPredicate;
  142.   return {
  143.     Predicate,
  144.     ComparisonPredicate,
  145.     CompoundPredicate,
  146.   };
  147. };
